tatami.pc.util.XML

Class XMLTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • tatami.pc.util.XML.XMLTree

  • public class XMLTree
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that contains the data that was read from (or that will be written to) an XML file. The class also contains functions (like cNode(), finishNode() and reset()) and support (see newNode(), newAttribute()) to keep a current position (current node) in the tree. See the JavaDoc for the functions for particular details. Most functions return the tree itself, so that chained calls can be used. E.g. new XMLTree(root).newNode(node1).newAttribute(someAttribute).finishNode().newNode(nodeSibilingWithNode1);
    Author:
    Andrei Olaru

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  XMLTree.XMLNode
      A class that contains the data corresponding to a node (element) in an XMLTree / XML file.

      (package private) XMLTree.XMLNode root 
      (package private) java.util.Stack<XMLTree.XMLNode> stack
      Keeps information for finding the current position in the tree (and allowing going up and down in the tree).

      XMLTree newNode(XMLTree.XMLNode node)

      XMLTree reset()

      java.lang.String toString()

    • Field Detail

      • root

        XMLTree.XMLNode root

      • stack

        java.util.Stack<XMLTree.XMLNode> stack
        Keeps information for finding the current position in the tree (and allowing going up and down in the tree). stack.peek() is the current node.

        public XMLTree(XMLTree.XMLNode rootNode)
        Creates a new XMLTree. The current node becomes the root.

        public XMLTree newNode(XMLTree.XMLNode node)
        Inserts a new node in the tree, as a child of the current node. The new node becomes current node.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the updated XMLTree.

      • moveDown

        public XMLTree moveDown(XMLTree.XMLNode node)
        Alias of moveToChild()

      • moveToChild

        public XMLTree moveToChild(XMLTree.XMLNode node)
        The specified child of the current node becomes current node.
        Parameters:
        node - XMLTree.XMLNode to become current node; must be a child of the current node.
        Returns:
        the XMLTree.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified node is not a child of the current node.

      • moveUp

        public XMLTree moveUp()
        Alias of finishNode().

      • finishNode

        public XMLTree finishNode()
        Goes up one level in the tree: the parent of the current node becomes current node.
        Returns:
        the XMLTree.

      • reset

        public XMLTree reset()
        The root of the XMLTree becomes current node.
        Returns:
        the XMLTree.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        The function does not affect the current node.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a String representation of the tree, one node on each line, correctly indented.
